sentence:
Home improvement warehouse operator The Home Depot, Inc. ( HD ) on Wednesday raised its full-year 2010 earnings guidance while providing its 2011 outlook

The company said it now expects full-year 2010 revenue to rise 2.3% from 2009, with profits rising to $1.97 per share.
It had previously predicted 2010 sales growth of 2.2% with profits of $1.94.
On average, Wall Street analysts expect a profit of $1.94 per share for the year.
For 2011, Home Depot predicted sales growth of 2% to 2.5%, comparable sales up in the low-single-digits, 10 new store openings, and operating EPS growth of 7% to 9%.
Shares of Home Depot ( HD ) have a 2.80% dividend yield, based on last night's closing stock price of $33.55.
The stock has technical support in the $30 price area.
If the shares can firm up, we see overhead resistance around the $36 price levels.
The Home Depot, Inc. ( HD ) is not recommended at this time, holding a Dividend.com DARSâ„¢ Rating of 3.4 out of 5 stars.
